name: react-component
title: React Component
description: Template for creating a new React component with tests

variables.name: component_name
variables.description: Component name in PascalCase (e.g., UserProfile, Button)

variables.name: component_type
variables.description: Type of component (functional, page, layout, form)

variables.name: description
variables.description: Brief description of the component's purpose
variables.example: Displays user profile information with avatar and stats

variables.name: props
variables.description: Main props the component will accept (comma-separated)

content:
# {{component_name}} Component

## Overview
{{description}}

## Requirements

### Component Type
- **Type**: {{component_type}} component
- **Styling**: {{styling}}

### Props
{{props}}

### Functionality
- Implement {{component_name}} with proper TypeScript types
- Handle loading and error states
- Make component accessible (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
- Follow existing component patterns in the codebase

### Styling
- Match existing design system
- Responsive design (mobile, tablet, desktop)
- Support dark/light theme if applicable

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] {{component_name}} component is created
- [ ] TypeScript types are defined for props
- [ ] Component renders correctly with all prop variations
- [ ] Loading and error states are handled
- [ ] Component is accessible
- [ ] Unit tests cover main scenarios
- [ ] Storybook story created (if using Storybook)

## Out of Scope
- Backend API changes
- Changes to other components
- New dependencies (unless absolutely necessary)
